rename.from: OneDrive in shared folders - listing issue
rename.to: OneDrive and shared folders - listing issue

body:
Hi hogmac,

This is actually a [known](https://forum.rclone.org/t/onedrive-issues-crypt-drive-from-shared-folder-cant-delete-files/6607/10) and partially-fixed problem and it's related to Microsoft's limitation on the API for shared folders. We're still thinking about how to deal with it. I should have opened an issue earlier... But anyway, thanks for reporting!

@Cnly is this issue causing `sync` won't skip existing files on shared folder? Or is it another issue to report to?

```bash
adam@somewhere:~ # fallocate -l 100M foobar/test.dat
adam@somewhere:~ # ll foobar/
total 102408
drwxr-xr-x  2 adam adam      4096 Nov  3 14:10 .
drwx------ 35 adam adam      4096 Nov  3 14:10 ..
-rw-r--r--  1 adam adam 104857600 Nov  3 14:10 test.dat
adam@somewhere:~ # rclone sync ./foobar onedrive-shared:foobar -Pc --delete-during
Transferred:   	  100.024M / 100 MBytes, 100%, 2.372 MBytes/s, ETA -
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0 / 0, -
Transferred:            0 / 1, 0%
Elapsed time:       42.1s
Transferring:
 *                                      test.dat: 100% /100M, 2.610M/s, -
# running again same command should skip `test.dat`, but it is not:
adam@somewhere:~ # rclone sync ./foobar onedrive-shared:foobar -Pc --delete-during
Transferred:   	  100.024M / 100 MBytes, 100%, 2.120 MBytes/s, ETA -
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0 / 0, -
Transferred:            0 / 1, 0%
Elapsed time:       47.1s
Transferring:
 *                                      test.dat: 100% /100M, 1.886M/s, -
```
@kusmierz Can you re-run that command with `-vv` flag? We should be able to see what's happening with more debug logs!

sure (just changed 100M file to 10M):
```
2018/11/05 08:18:37 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.44" starting with parameters ["rclone" "-vv" "sync" "./foobar" "onedrive-shared:foobar" "-c" "--delete-during"]
2018/11/05 08:18:37 DEBUG : Using config file from "/home/adam/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2018/11/05 08:18:41 INFO  : Waiting for deletions to finish
2018/11/05 08:18:41 INFO  : Encrypted drive 'onedrive-shared:foobar': Waiting for checks to finish
2018/11/05 08:18:41 INFO  : Encrypted drive 'onedrive-shared:foobar': Waiting for transfers to finish
2018/11/05 08:18:43 DEBUG : hv1frabrt9evhqr1fjmokg6fnk: Starting multipart upload
2018/11/05 08:18:43 DEBUG : hv1frabrt9evhqr1fjmokg6fnk: Uploading segment 0/10488352 size 10485760
2018/11/05 08:18:48 DEBUG : hv1frabrt9evhqr1fjmokg6fnk: Uploading segment 10485760/10488352 size 2592
2018/11/05 08:18:48 INFO  : test.dat: Copied (new)
2018/11/05 08:18:48 INFO  : 
Transferred:   	   10.002M / 10.002 MBytes, 100%, 910.421 kBytes/s, ETA 0s
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0 / 0, -
Transferred:            1 / 1, 100%
Elapsed time:       11.2s

2018/11/05 08:18:48 DEBUG : 8 go routines active
2018/11/05 08:18:48 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.44" finishing with parameters ["rclone" "-vv" "sync" "./foobar" "onedrive-shared:foobar" "-c" "--delete-during"]
```

> 
> 
> @Cnly is this issue causing `sync` won't skip existing files on shared folder? Or is it another issue to report to?
> 
> ```shell
> adam@somewhere:~ # fallocate -l 100M foobar/test.dat
> adam@somewhere:~ # ll foobar/
> total 102408
> drwxr-xr-x  2 adam adam      4096 Nov  3 14:10 .
> drwx------ 35 adam adam      4096 Nov  3 14:10 ..
> -rw-r--r--  1 adam adam 104857600 Nov  3 14:10 test.dat
> adam@somewhere:~ # rclone sync ./foobar onedrive-shared:foobar -Pc --delete-during
> Transferred:   	  100.024M / 100 MBytes, 100%, 2.372 MBytes/s, ETA -
> Errors:                 0
> Checks:                 0 / 0, -
> Transferred:            0 / 1, 0%
> Elapsed time:       42.1s
> Transferring:
>  *                                      test.dat: 100% /100M, 2.610M/s, -
> # running again same command should skip `test.dat`, but it is not:
> adam@somewhere:~ # rclone sync ./foobar onedrive-shared:foobar -Pc --delete-during
> Transferred:   	  100.024M / 100 MBytes, 100%, 2.120 MBytes/s, ETA -
> Errors:                 0
> Checks:                 0 / 0, -
> Transferred:            0 / 1, 0%
> Elapsed time:       47.1s
> Transferring:
>  *                                      test.dat: 100% /100M, 1.886M/s, -
> ```

same issue wit onedrive shared folders..  sync or copy uploading files again...is there an y work around ?

issue.title: @saisimha Sync only working with parent Folders

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Hi, So after a little bit of more digging I was able to narrow down the issue.

So, Sync on Shared Folders is only working one Root Parent Folder. if I try to sync the subFolder, rclone is not able to see the files and Files are being uploaded again .

body: Thank you all for reporting the issues with shared folders. I've got some time to sit down and try to fix the compatibility recently, and now I'd like to ask you to help test things out. You can download the beta here: https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.45-043-g108ec53c-onedrive-sharedfolders-beta/ and check if you're still having the problems. Please let me know if there's anything. :)

nice Christmas present, thank you @Cnly :)

I've tested with my sample data as seen above (`onedrive-shared` is encrypted btw):
```bash
adam@somewhere:~ $ dd if=/dev/urandom of=./foobar/test.dat bs=1024 count=102400
102400+0 records in
102400+0 records out
104857600 bytes (105 MB, 100 MiB) copied, 0.738168 s, 142 MB/s
adam@somewhere:~ $ ll foobar/
total 102412
drwxr-xr-x  2 root root      4096 Dec 26 12:02 .
drwxr-xr-x 50 adam adam      4096 Dec 26 12:02 ..
-rw-r--r--  1 root root 104857600 Dec 26 12:04 test.dat
adam@somewhere:~ $ sha1sum foobar/test.dat 
ce60b5c901d84416fd662f890e9dd8c958879cad  foobar/test.dat
adam@somewhere:~ $ rclone sync ./foobar onedrive-shared:foobar -Pc --delete-during
Transferred:   	  100.024M / 100.024 MBytes, 100%, 419.628 kBytes/s, ETA 0s
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 1 / 1, 100%
Transferred:            1 / 1, 100%
Elapsed time:        4m4s
adam@somewhere:~ $ rclone sync ./foobar onedrive-shared:foobar -Pc --delete-during
Transferred:   	         0 / 0 Bytes, -, 0 Bytes/s, ETA -
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 1 / 1, 100%
Transferred:            0 / 0, -
Elapsed time:        2.4s
# checking even more...
adam@somewhere:~ $ rclone copyto onedrive-shared:foobar/test.dat ./foobar/test.copied.dat
adam@somewhere:~ $ sha1sum foobar/test.copied.dat 
ce60b5c901d84416fd662f890e9dd8c958879cad  foobar/test.copied.dat
adam@somewhere:~ $ diff -s foobar/*
Files foobar/test.copied.dat and foobar/test.dat are identical
adam@somewhere:~ $ rclone ls onedrive-shared:foobar
104857600 test.dat
adam@somewhere:~ $ rclone delete onedrive-shared:foobar/test.dat
adam@somewhere:~ $ rclone ls onedrive-shared:foobar
adam@somewhere:~ $ rclone rmdir onedrive-shared:foobar
adam@somewhere:~ $ rclone ls onedrive-shared:foobar
2018/12/26 12:15:20 ERROR : : error listing: directory not found
2018/12/26 12:15:20 Failed to ls: directory not found
adam@somewhere:~ $ rclone lsd onedrive-shared:
adam@somewhere:~ $ 
```

listing:
```bash
adam@somewhere:~ $ rclone lsd onedrive-shared:
          -1 2018-12-26 12:13:09         1 Photos
          -1 2018-12-26 12:08:50         1 foobar
adam@somewhere:~ $ rclone lsd onedrive-shared:Photos
          -1 2018-12-26 12:13:18        27 Something
adam@somewhere:~ $ rclone lsd onedrive-shared:Photos/Something
          -1 2018-12-26 10:38:24         2 2005
          -1 2018-12-26 10:39:09         3 2006
          -1 2018-12-26 12:13:24         8 2007
          -1 2018-12-26 12:13:22        10 2008
          -1 2018-12-26 12:10:19         6 2009
          -1 2018-12-26 12:13:20         6 2010
          -1 2018-12-26 12:06:12         3 2011
          -1 2018-12-26 12:13:25         9 2012
          -1 2018-12-26 12:13:21         3 2013
          -1 2018-12-26 12:13:23         8 2014
          -1 2018-12-26 12:04:08         5 2015
          -1 2018-12-26 11:58:18         5 2016
          -1 2018-11-03 13:53:27         3 2017
          -1 2018-10-09 10:20:34         8 2018
adam@somewhere:~ $ rclone lsd onedrive-shared:Photos/Something/2005
          -1 2018-12-26 10:38:24         2 10
          -1 2018-12-26 10:36:41        21 Unknown
```

works like a charm as far as I can see :)

now I'm uploading ~250G (20k+ files), I'll post here `rclone sync`'s output later.

This is just great! Thanks @Cnly 

Doing some quick tests - everything for shared folders seems to be working ok as on non-shared ones.  Also renaming over on a mounted drive is now possible. :)

First run:
```
Transferred:   	  256.345G / 256.345 GBytes, 100%, 18.806 MBytes/s, ETA 0s
Errors:                 0
Checks:               990 / 990, 100%
Transferred:        25199 / 25199, 100%
Elapsed time:  3h52m38.1s
```
second run:
```
Transferred:   	         0 / 0 Bytes, -, 0 Bytes/s, ETA -
Errors:                 0
Checks:             26186 / 26186, 100%
Transferred:            0 / 0, -
Elapsed time:       43.8s
```
quick check:
```
# find . -type f | wc -l
26186
# touch test
# rclone sync . onedrive-shared:Something -Pu --transfers 50 --delete-during
Transferred:   	        32 / 32 Bytes, 100%, 0 Bytes/s, ETA 0s
Errors:                 0
Checks:             26186 / 26186, 100%
Transferred:            1 / 1, 100%
Elapsed time:       38.7s
# rm test
# rclone sync . onedrive-shared:Something -Pu --transfers 50 --delete-during
je onedrive-photos:Zdjcia/Moje -Pu --transfers 100 --delete-during
Transferred:   	         0 / 0 Bytes, -, 0 Bytes/s, ETA -
Errors:                 0
Checks:             26187 / 26187, 100%
Transferred:            0 / 0, -
Elapsed time:       40.6s
```
Despite last summary has no info about removed file, but everything seems to work correctly ;)
I don't know if I should open another ticket but I can't list/download shared folders on onedrive for business either
@Brandhor Are you testing with the patched version which you can find here: https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/2536#issuecomment-449932896 ?
